Hi there! In this blog post, I will be using regex to look for objects in strings, a very useful tool in genetics research.

```{python}
import re
#Naming string with IUPAC conventions for genes
string1=""

#Matching restriction enzyme binding sites ANTAAT and GCRWTG
re.findall(r'(A.TAAT)|(GC[A|G][A|T]TG)', string1)
#ANT\AAT restriction enzyme cut
list1=re.split(r'(.+A.T)(AAT.+)', string1)

```
